item.title: Publish a blog on GitHub Pages with Ghost and Buster
item.description:
It's no secret: I am using Ghost as a blogging engine (see footer). This is a quick walk-through of how I publish this blog to GitHub Pages using Buster.

This article assumes:
You have Ghost setup locally.
You have a GitHub account.

Get Buster

  1. Install pip.
    • Download the get-pip.py script from https://pip.pypa.io/en/latest/installing.html#install-pip.
    • Run python get-pip.py --no-index --find-links=/local/copies.
  2. Install buster.
    • Run pip install buster.

Generate static site

  1. If you have not used buster before, run buster setup. It will ask you for the URL of your GitHub repository.
  2. Start your local ghost instance with npm start in your ghost directory. This serves your ghost content at http://127.0.0.1:2368.
  3. Run buster generate --domain=http://127.0.0.1:2368 --dir=/path/to/store/static/content. The path you specify in the dir parameter will now contain a static copy of your ghost content.

Push to GitHub

  1. Run git init in your static content directory.
  2. Add a remote linking to a repository on your GitHub account git remote add https://github.com/yourusername/repo.git.
  3. Create a gh-pages branch with git checkout -b gh-pages. This is critical! If you do not push your changes to this version, GitHub will not serve your content.
  4. Run git push origin gh-pages.

That's all folks!
